message.content:
cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.CR, cs.SI 

The paper proposes a novel solution to spam detection using a bio-inspired algorithm, which falls under the category of artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The paper also compares its results with other binary classification methods, indicating a focus on machine learning (cs.LG) and information retrieval (cs.IR). The use of a cross-regulation model for spam detection also suggests a focus on security and cryptography (cs.CR). Finally, the mention of concept drift in the title suggests a possible focus on machine learning in dynamic environments, which falls under the category of social and information networks (cs.SI).
